title: Jury sides with Gwyneth Paltrow in ski crash trial
description: A verdict has been reached in the civil trial between Gwyneth Paltrow and Terry Sanderson over a 2016 ski crash.

title: WATCH:  Former President Donald Trump indicted by Manhattan grand jury
description: Donald Trump is now the first former U.S. president to be indicted.

title: Trump becomes 1st current or former president to be indicted
description: A Manhattan grand jury has indicted former President Trump, according to multiple sources, making him the first current or former president to face criminal charges.

title: Trump indictment marks unprecedented moment in presidential history
description: Trump's indictment marks an unprecedented development in the country's history -- the first time a former president has ever faced criminal charges

title: Ex-Boston officer charged with assaulting cop in Jan. 6 riot
description: A former Boston police officer has been arrested on charges that he assaulted a police officer after storming the U.S. Capitol with the mob of President Donald Trump supporters on Jan. 6, 2021

title: WATCH:  Dog quickly rethinks his decision to jump in the snow
description: It took Hugo the goldendoodle a few seconds to change his mind about the nor'easter snow.

title: New FBI docs: Las Vegas mass shooter was angry at casinos
description: FBI documents made public this week reveal the high-roller gambler who opened fire on concertgoers on the Las Vegas Strip had lost tens of thousands of dollars while gambling weeks earlier

title: Man charged in 20-plus calls of false threats in US, Canada
description: U.S. authorities say they arrested a Washington state man who made more than 20 “swatting” calls around the country and in Canada, prompting real emergency responses to his fake reports of bombs, shootings or other threats

title: Biden pick Ajay Banga cleared to take top job at World Bank
description: The Biden administration’s choice to run the World Bank — former Mastercard CEO Ajay Banga — appears to have a lock on the job

title: McCarthy dodges on assault weapons ban after Nashville school shooting
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said Thursday that lawmakers aren't considering new gun reforms such as an assault weapons ban in the aftermath of the Nashville shooting.

title: City grants most gig workers paid sick leave
description: Seattle marks the first city to permanently offer paid sick leave for gig workers.

title: North Carolina man wins lottery for 2nd time in nearly 2 years
description: A North Carolina man has won $2 million playing the lottery. It's the second time Pharris Frank has won in nearly two years.

title: Average long-term mortgage rate at lowest level in six weeks
description: The average long-term U.S. mortgage rate inched down this week to its lowest level in six weeks, just as the spring buying season gets underway

title: Canada mass shooting inquiry identifies many police failings
description: A public inquiry has found widespread failures in how Canada’s federal police force responded to the country’s worst mass shooting

title: Maine 19-year-old will plead guilty in mosque attack plot
description: A 19-year-old from Maine who is accused of producing homemade explosive devices and making plans to attack a mosque will plead guilty to providing material support to terrorists

title: Roku to slash 200 jobs, amounting to 6% of workforce
description: The announcement from Roku matches a previous round of layoffs that affected 200 workers.

title: Prince Harry back in court for phone hacking hearing finale
description: Prince Harry has returned to a London court as his lawyer fought to keep his phone hacking lawsuit against a British tabloid publisher alive

title: US revises down last quarter's economic growth to 2.6% rate
description: The U.S. economy maintained its resilience from October through December despite rising interest rates, growing at a 2.6% annual pace, the government said Thursday in a slight downgrade from its previous estimate

title: More Americans file for jobless claims; layoffs remain low
description: U.S. applications for jobless benefits rose last week but remain at historically low levels despite the Federal Reserve’s efforts to cool the economy and job market in its fight against inflation

title: Oscar Pistorius eligible for parole, could be free this week
description: Former Olympic runner Oscar Pistorius has applied for parole and is expected to attend a hearing on Friday that will decide if he can be released from prison 10 years after killing girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp

title: Bolsonaro returns to Brazil after 3-month stint in Florida
description: Former President Jair Bolsonaro has arrived back in Brazil after a three-month stay in Florida

title: 4 bankers convicted over Swiss account of longtime Putin pal
description: Four former bankers with the Swiss affiliate of a key Russian bank have been found guilty of failing to properly check accounts opened in the name of a Russian cellist with longtime ties to President Vladimir Putin

title: China renews warnings as Taiwan's Tsai stops over in US
description: As Taiwan’s president began a stopover in the United States on her way to Central America, China said it is closely watching developments

title: Nashville school shooting updates: Victims honored in citywide vigil
description: Hundreds of people gathered at a candlelight vigil in Nashville on Wednesday evening to mourn and honor the six victims of a mass shooting at an elementary school.

title: Evacuation order issued near Minnesota train derailment
description: This is a developing story.

title: China's No. 2 leader says economy improved in March
description: China’s new No. 2 leader says its economic recovery improved in March and he promised to stay committed to opening to the world

title: 2 Army Black Hawk helicopters crash in Kentucky
description: Two U.S. Army Black Hawk helicopters crashed during a training incident on Wednesday night in Trigg County, Kentucky, officials said in a statement.

title: Philippine ferry fire leaves 12 dead, at least 7 missing
description: A ferry carrying about 250 passengers and crew caught fire between Philippine islands and at least 12 people were killed with seven still missing

title: WATCH:  Congressmen battle over gun violence outside House chamber
description: Tense moments between congressmen outside the House chamber as Rep. Jamaal Bowman, a former principal, implores reporters to continue to press Republicans on the issue of gun violence.

title: 7 officers charged over in-custody death of man who shouted 'I can't breathe'
description: Seven California Highway Patrol officers have been charged with involuntary manslaughter over the 2020 in-custody death of a man who repeatedly said "I can't breathe."

title: Biden won't veto Republican-led bill ending COVID emergency
description: President Joe Biden won’t veto a Republican-led measure to end the national COVID emergency
